ingredients: 500g mutton (goat or lamb, cut into pieces), 1/2 cup plain yogurt, 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, 2 tablespoons ghee or oil, 2 large onions, finely sliced, 1/4 cup cashew nuts (soaked in warm water for 30 minutes), 1/4 cup coconut (grated or desiccated, optional), 1 tablespoon ginger-garlic paste, 2 tomatoes, chopped or pureed, 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder, 1 teaspoon red chili powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 teaspoon garam masala, 1/2 teaspoon ground cardamom, 1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon, 1/4 cup cream or coconut milk, Fresh coriander leaves for garnish, Salt to taste.
instructions: In a bowl, mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, ground coriander, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Add the mutton pieces and coat them well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour, or overnight for best results.

Heat ghee or oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and cook until golden brown. Remove half for garnishing later. Add ginger-garlic paste to the remaining onions and cook until fragrant. Add chopped or pureed tomatoes and cook until the oil starts separating from the mixture.
Blend the soaked cashew nuts and grated coconut into a smooth paste using a little water.

Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, ground coriander, garam masala, ground cardamom, and ground cinnamon to the onion-tomato mixture. Add the marinated mutton and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Stir in the nut and coconut paste, mix well, and cook for a few minutes. Add cream or coconut milk and cook on low heat for 40-45 minutes, or until the mutton is tender and the sauce is thickened. Add water if needed to adjust the consistency.
Garnish with the reserved fried onions and fresh coriander leaves. Serve hot with naan, roti, or rice.
